required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Study of Genotropin (Somatropin) for Short Children Born Small for Gestational Age (SGA)
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term Study Of Pnu-180307 For Short Children Born Small For Gestational Age (Sga) Without Epiphyseal Closure (Extension Of The Study 307-met-0021-002)

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the long-term safety of Genotropin(somatropin) on Small for Gestational Age (SGA) without epiphyseal closing.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156

secondary_outcome.measure: Height Velocity Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
secondary_outcome.description: Height velocity is the yearly height gain. Height velocity SDS is calculated as following formula; Height velocity SDS = (height velocity - mean) / standard deviation, where mean and standard deviation were based on standard Japanese values of the participants age and gender. The scores were centred around zero. Negative score indicated a participant was smaller for their age/gender.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
secondary_outcome.description: Height velocity is the yearly height gain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
secondary_outcome.description: Height SDS is calculated as following formula; Height SDS = (height - mean) / standard deviation, where mean and standard deviation were based on standard Japanese values on the participant age and gender. The scores were centred around zero. Negative score indicated a participant was smaller for their age/gender.

secondary_outcome.measure: Height Velocity SDS for Bone Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
secondary_outcome.description: To measure bone age, X-ray images of the left hand were centrally assessed by an independent specialist using the Tanner-Whitehouse 2 (RUS) method standardized for Japanese children. Height velocity is the yearly height gain. Height velocity SDS for bone age is calculated as following formula; Height velocity SDS = (height velocity - mean) / standard deviation, where mean and standard deviation were based on standard Japanese values corresponding to bone age and gender. The scores were centred around zero. Negative score indicated a participant was smaller for their age/gender.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
secondary_outcome.description: To measure bone age, X-ray images of the left hand were centrally assessed by an independent specialist using the Tanner-Whitehouse 2 (RUS) method standardized for Japanese children. Height SDS for bone age is calculated as following formula; Height SDS = (height - mean) / standard deviation, where mean and standard deviation were based on standard Japanese values corresponding to bone age and gender. The scores were centred around zero. Negative score indicated a participant was smaller for their age/gender.

clinical_study.condition: Short Stature Born Small for Gestational Age (SGA)

intervention.description: Genotropin(somatoropin) 12 mg, Genotropin(somatropin) will be given at a dose of 0.067 mg/kg/day or 0.033 mg/kg/day to all participating patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Children with short stature due to SGA who received treatment in the study GENASG-0021-002.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who have any chronic disease requiring treatment with steroid hormone that may affect growth promotion including estrogen, androgen, anabolic hormone, and corticosteroids (except those for external use), and have received the treatment.
- Children who have received radiotherapy or chemotherapy.
- Children who have serious cardiac disease, renal disease, or hepatic disease.
- Children who have diabetes mellitus with a manifestation of abnormal glucose metabolism.
- Children who have serious chronic disease.
- Children who have malignant tumor.
- Children who are allergic to m-cresol.

facility.name: University of Occupational and Environmental Health Hospital
Hokkaido Social Service Association Obihiro Hospital
Osaka Medical Center and Research Institute for Maternal and Child Health
Federal Officers' Mutual Aid Association Toranomon Hospital
National Center for Child Health and Development

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Before enrolled this study, participants with short stature due to SGA had completed the 1-year(12-month) treatment in previous study. Out of 62 participants who were enrolled this study, 61 participants were treated.

group.title: Dose-Increasing Group
group.description: Participants who were treated with somatropin 0.033 mg/kg/day in previous study for 12 months received a dose of 0.067 mg/kg/day

group.title: Dose-Remaining Group
group.description: Participants who were treated with somatropin 0.067 mg/kg/day in previous study for 12 months were maintained on the same dose

group.title: Dose-Increasing Group
group.description: Participants who were treated with somatropin 0.033 mg/kg/day in previous study for 12 months received a dose of 0.067 mg/kg/day

group.title: Dose-Remaining Group
group.description: Participants who were treated with somatropin 0.067 mg/kg/day in previous study for 12 months were maintained on the same dose

outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) included participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least one observation after enrollment of this study.

outcome.title: Height Velocity SDS for Bone Age
outcome.description: To measure bone age, X-ray images of the left hand were centrally assessed by an independent specialist using the Tanner-Whitehouse 2 (RUS) method standardized for Japanese children. Height velocity is the yearly height gain. Height velocity SDS for bone age is calculated as following formula; Height velocity SDS = (height velocity - mean) / standard deviation, where mean and standard deviation were based on standard Japanese values corresponding to bone age and gender. The scores were centred around zero. Negative score indicated a participant was smaller for their age/gender.
outcome.time_frame: Month 12 (at the end of previous study) to 156
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) included participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least one observation after enrollment of this study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Restriction Description: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
